summary: This is an FBI FD-302 interview summary of a witness, identified as a former underage victim/recruiter for Jeffrey Epstein. The witness details being recruited at age 14, bringing other underage girls to Epstein's residence for massages that escalated to sexual acts, and Epstein's preferences and payment methods. The document also covers the witness's later interactions with Epstein's associates and law enforcement.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The central subject of the investigation. The witness describes being recruited by him at age 14, bringing other underage girls to his residence for massages that involved sexual acts, and his specific preferences for young girls.

persons.name: Sarah
persons.context: The primary witness being interviewed. She was introduced to Epstein at age 14, brought other underage girls to him over several years, and describes the routine, payments, and Epstein's behavior.

persons.name: Tiffany
persons.context: A friend of the witness who was also introduced to Epstein as an underage girl. She attended Epstein's residence with the witness.

persons.name: Adriana
persons.context: Described as Epstein's 'live-in assistant' who would sometimes call the witness, take her phone number, and arrange for girls to be brought to Epstein.

persons.name: Bob Critton
persons.context: Mentioned by 'Sarah' (Epstein's associate) as the person who would provide information to the witness after Epstein's arrest, implying a protective or legal role.

persons.name: Sarah (Epstein's associate)
persons.context: A person (distinct from the witness) who answered Epstein's phone after his arrest, told the witness not to worry, and mentioned Bob Critton. Likely an assistant or close associate.

persons.name: Maria
persons.context: A girl the witness brought to Epstein who looked very young. Epstein gave her and the witness $300 each, but she was shaken up and never wanted to return.

persons.name: Jill
persons.context: A girl, aged 16 or 17, whom the witness brought to Epstein. She stormed out during the encounter.

persons.name: Nadia
persons.context: A woman the witness met in prison who said she had also gone to Epstein's residence. Her friend 'Isabella' also went.

persons.name: Isabella
persons.context: Friend of 'Nadia' who also went to Epstein's residence.

connections.description: Epstein recruited the underage witness for sexual massages and later used her to recruit other underage girls.
Friends who attended high school parties together and were both introduced to Epstein.
Adriana, as Epstein's assistant, would contact the witness to arrange for girls to be brought to Epstein.
Adriana is described as Epstein's 'live-in assistant' who facilitated his activities.
The associate answered Epstein's phone after his arrest and reassured the witness, indicating a close working relationship.
The associate told the witness that Bob Critton would provide information, suggesting a professional connection.
The witness brought the underage girl Maria to Epstein for a massage that involved sexual acts.
The witness brought the teenage girl Jill to Epstein, who then stormed out.

events.title: Witness's Recruitment and Ongoing Visits to Epstein
events.description: The witness, at age 14, is introduced to Jeffrey Epstein and begins visiting his residence approximately 60 times over 3-4 years to provide massages that escalate to sexual acts, and to recruit other underage girls.

events.title: FBI Interview of Witness
events.description: The witness is interviewed by the FBI, an AUSA, and a Task Force Officer at a law firm in Fort Lauderdale, providing detailed information about her experiences with Epstein.

events.title: Epstein's Arrest and Aftermath
events.description: After seeing Epstein's mug shot on TV, the witness calls his number and speaks to an associate ('Sarah') who tells her not to worry and that Bob Critton will provide information, implying she will be 'taken care of.'

events.title: Witness Harassment by Epstein Investigators
events.description: The witness hears that Epstein's investigators are harassing her by shining lights in her window, forcing her to be placed in a hotel for safety.

events.title: Media Contact and Interview
events.description: The witness is contacted by the media, including the Miami Herald, and gives an interview. Afterwards, she is constantly called by journalists and has to change her phone number.

locations: 401 E Las Olas Blvd, Fort Lauderdale, Florida (Law offices of Boies Schiller Flexner - interview location)
Epstein's residence (location of the abuse, specific address not given in this excerpt)
keyFacts: The witness was introduced to Jeffrey Epstein at age 14 under the pretense of giving a massage for $200, and estimated visiting his residence about 60 times over 3-4 years.
Epstein paid the witness $200 for each underage girl she brought to him, and he was very specific about preferring young girls, explicitly disliking black or mixed girls.
The witness described a routine where two girls would massage Epstein together for about 30 minutes before he would ask one to leave, and he was always paid in cash with $100 bills.
After Epstein's arrest, an associate answered his phone, told the witness not to worry, and indicated she would be 'taken care of,' suggesting ongoing efforts to manage witnesses.
The witness reported being harassed by Epstein's investigators, who shone lights in her window, forcing her to relocate to a hotel for safety.
